definition: one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit

sentences.english: After winning the lottery jackpot, he went from rags to riches overnight.
sentences.chinese: 贏了樂透頭彩後，他一夕之間從一貧如洗變成富翁。

sentences.english: Her family was impoverished by a fire.
sentences.chinese: 她的家庭被一場梆弄得一貧如洗。

sentences.english: Saibya was penniless and wept bitterly at her unending misfortunes.
sentences.chinese: 賽伯亞一貧如洗，爲自己無休止的不幸而悲痛地哭泣。

sentences.english: When Mr Smith died his wife and childern were left destitute .
sentences.chinese: 史密斯先生死後他的妻兒變得一貧如洗。

sentences.english: Many sailors drink their wives and children out of doors.
sentences.chinese: 溺於酒以致妻兒一貧如洗。

sentences.english: Even the dogs lead a better life than him.
sentences.chinese: 他真的一貧如洗，生活潦倒得連狗都不如。

sentences.english: After making a fortune in business, he finished up poor at his death.
sentences.chinese: 他做生意發過大財，但臨終時他一貧如洗。

sentences.english: Her exceptional musical talent took he from rags to riches.
sentences.chinese: 她傑出的音樂才能使她從一貧如洗到家財萬貫。

sentences.english: In those years the landless peasants were brought to beggary.
sentences.chinese: 在那些年月裏無地的農民一貧如洗。

definition: lit. ten thousand strings of cash in money belt (idiom); carrying lots of money/extremely wealthy/loaded
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
to take refuge in religious life
lit. cannot rest or eat in peace (idiom)/fig. extremely worried and troubled
devotion to righteousness that inspires reverence (idiom)
to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: to murder without blinking an eye (idiom)/ruthless/cold-blooded
lit. chickens flying and dogs jumping (idiom)/fig. in chaos/in disarray
to have no sense of shame/brazen
